p.value: Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
The collection is arranged alphabetically in two series.

Miscellany Magazine ran from 1929 - 1931 and comprised 6 issues. It was edited by Frederick W. Dupee, Geoffrey T. Hellman, George L. Kingsland Morris, and Dwight MacDonald. The magazine featured poetry, essays, and film, art, and literature reviews. It was based in New York City.
The collection had been housed at NYU's Fales Library from at least the 1990s. The provenance of the collection is unclear.

physdesc.value: 0.25 Linear Feet in 1 half manuscript box.

abstract.value: Miscellany Magazine ran from 1929 - 1931 and comprised 6 issues. The magazine featured poetry, essays, and film, art, and literature reviews. It was based in New York City. The collection contains correspondence, advertisers, contributions, subscriber lists, and reviews of Miscellany Magazine. There is also one issue of the magazine.

Published citations should take the following form:

Identification of item, date (if known); Miscellany Magazine Collection; MSS 261; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
This collection contains correspondence, advertisers, contributions, subscriber lists, and reviews of Miscellany Magazine. There is also one issue of the magazine.

Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Fales Library and Special Collections, fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.
